properties.areaDesc: Johnson, IN; Bartholomew, IN; Shelby, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:25AM EST until January 15 at 9:34AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

Big Blue River...East Fork White River...Flatrock River...
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has upgraded the
flood category from Minor to Moderate severity for the following
rivers and streams in Illinois...Indiana...

White River at Hazleton

...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has upgraded the
flood category from Minor to Moderate severity for the following
rivers and streams

Driftwood River near Edinburgh 2 SW
East Fork White River at Seymour
White River near Centerton
White River below Eagle Valley Power Plant
White River at Spencer
White River at Elliston
White River at Edwardsport
White River at Petersburg


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 2 inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Driftwood River near Edinburgh 2 SW.
* from Saturday afternoon to Wednesday morning.
* At  9:30 AM Friday the stage was 4.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 14.9 feet by late Sunday night.  It will
fall below flood stage by Tuesday evening.
* At 14.9 feet...Extensive flooding along Driftwood River in northern
Bartholomew County on March 7 2011.   Double Y Saddle Club area
extensively flooded.  Water flowing over CR 950 N to Club.  CR 330W
is flooded just south of its intersection with Ohio Ridge Rd.  CR
500N west of CR 250W is flooded blocking vehicular access to
residences near the river bank.  Lowell Public Access site is
completely flooded.  Water very near several residences and
seasonal homes along CR 330W and CR 325W.

NWSheadline: Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity
